alert.note: Alert for Northern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 21 at 9:59AM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to four inches with blowing and drifting snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills 15 to 25 below zero. * WHERE...Elk River, Highway 11 Pierce to Headquarters, and Pierce. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 4 PM this afternoon to 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be affected. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
